column4: All colors in videos looks strange in Ubuntu 10.04: water is red, people's tan is blue...
How can I solve that?
perhaps your rose-colored glasses need tuning ;-)
what's your color depth in xorg.conf? ("grep Depth /etc/X11/xorg.conf")
(I'm just thinking perhaps your colormap is a little off due to depth)
huh, that should be fine. Using "xdpyinfo", does the section headed "supported pixmap formats:" include 32?
my xdpyinfo output: http://pastebin.com/eA6NPSWM
looking ...
looks good, and I'm quickly running out of immediate ideas; what kind of video card do you have? If nvidia, do you have nvidia-settings installed? Does it have any color modifications shown?
nvidia-settings is not installed, I'm installing it right now.
video previews in nautilus are fine by the way
heh ... of course, that would have made it "too easy"
if you have an nvidia, which driver are you using? (System -> Administration -> Hardware Drivers) Sounds like you may be using "nv" (the free version) vice "nvidia" (the binary-only release)
if you're using "nv", try "nvidia" (if you're not against using binary-only drivers, that is)
ok
where can I change "nv" to "nvidia", I couldn't figure out

System -> Administration -> Hardware Drivers. If it doesn't give you the option to activate the binary-only driver then you may need to "sudo apt-get install nvidia-current" (which *should* give you your dependencies)
oh, it is activated
okay ... huh ... I'm stumped, sorry
I'm gonna re-install :P
bummer, sorry man. I've done that too many times and know it's frustrating.
